member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo.Name
member.summary: Represents the name of the data variable requested with a getActiveUniform or getActiveAttrib call.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo.Size
member.summary: Represents the size of the data returned by getActiveUniform or getActiveAttrib calls.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLActiveInfo.Type
member.summary: Represents the type of data returned by a getActiveUniform or getActiveAttrib call.

member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLBuffer
member.summary: Represents a buffer object that contains numeric data such as vertices or colors. The WebGLBuffer object does not define any members.

member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes
member.summary: A dictionary object of attributes used to initialize the context for the first time.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.Alpha
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the drawing buffer has an alpha channel for alpha compositing and operations.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.Antialias
member.summary: Get or set the antialias state on a WebGL rendering context.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.Depth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the drawing buffer has a depth buffer. Returns false if no depth buffer exists.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.FailIfMajorPerformanceCaveat
member.summary: A flag that sets whether WebGL creates a context with getContext if system performance is low.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.PremultipliedAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the colors in the drawing buffer are premultiplied alpha values. This property is ignored if the alpha property is false.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLContextAttributes.PreserveDrawingBuffer
member.summary: Sets or gets whether the drawing buffer's is cleared once content is presented.

member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLFramebuffer
member.summary: Represents a collection of buffers that serve as a rendering destination. The WebGLFramebuffer object does not define any members.

member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat
member.summary: Provides the precision, rangeMin, and rangeMax properties returned by the getShaderPrecisionFormat method.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.Precision
member.summary: Represents the precision in bits for a given data type.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.RangeMax
member.summary: Gets the maximum positive value in log base 2 that can be represented by a type.

member.name: P:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLShaderPrecisionFormat.RangeMin
member.summary: Returns the base 2 log of the absolute value of the minimum value that can be represented.

member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLProgram
member.summary: Represents the programmable WebGL pipeline and associated shader programs. The WebGLProgram object does not define any members.

member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderbuffer
member.summary: Represents a buffer which can contain an image and act as the source or target of a render operation. The WebGLRenderbuffer object does not define any members. A renderbuffer stores data that represents a single image. A renderbuffer object can be attached to a framebuffer object and used to store either stencil data or a combination of stencil and depth data.

member.name: T:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext
member.summary: WebGLRenderingContext objects expose the WebGLRenderingContext interface, the principal interface in WebGL which provides special properties and methods to manipulate the 3D content rendered in an HTML canvas element. The docs sources are: https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/1.0/ https://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man/ https://developer.mozilla.org/ru/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/dn621085%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

WebGLRenderingContext objects expose the WebGLRenderingContext interface, the principal interface in WebGL which provides special properties and methods to manipulate the 3D content rendered in an HTML canvas element. The docs sources are: https://www.khronos.org/registry/webgl/specs/1.0/ https://www.khronos.org/opengles/sdk/docs/man/ https://developer.mozilla.org/ru/docs/Web/API/WebGLRenderingContext https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ie/dn621085%28v=vs.85%29.aspx

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT
member.summary: Passed to clear() to clear the current depth buffer

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT
member.summary: Passed to clear() to clear the current stencil buffer

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.COLOR_BUFFER_BIT
member.summary: Passed to clear() to clear the current color buffer

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.POINTS
member.summary: Draws a single dot per vertex. For example, 12 vertices produce 12 dots.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINES
member.summary: Draws a line between a pair of vertices. For example, 12 vertices produce 6 separate lines.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINE_LOOP
member.summary: Similar to gl.LINE_STRIP, but connects the last vertex back to the first. For example, 12 vertices produce 12 straight lines. Not as efficient as gl.LINES, and incurs a conversion cost.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINE_STRIP
member.summary: Draws a line to the next by a straight line. For example, 12 vertices produce 11 lines connected end to end.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TRIANGLES
member.summary: Draws a triangle for each group of three consecutive vertices. For example, 12 vertices create 4 separate triangles.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TRIANGLE_STRIP
member.summary: Creates a strip of triangles where each additional vertex creates an additional triangle once the first three vertices have been drawn. For example, 12 vertices create 10 triangles.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TRIANGLE_FAN
member.summary: Similar to gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP, but creates a fan shaped output. For example 12 vertices create 10 triangles. May incur a conversion cost.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ZERO
member.summary: The destination depends on the method that the constant is passed to.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ONE
member.summary: Factor: 1 1 1 1 Multiplies all colors by 1.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SRC_COLOR
member.summary: Factror: Rs Gs Bs As Multiply by source color value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR
member.summary: Factor: (1-Rs) (1-Gs) (1-Bs) (1-As) Multiply by 1 minus each color value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DST_COLOR
member.summary: Factor: Rd Gd Bd Ad Multiply by destination color value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR
member.summary: Factor: (1-Rd) (1-Gd) (1-Bd) (1-Ad) Multiply by 1 minus each color value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: Factor: As As As As Multiply all colors by source alpha value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: Factor: (1-As) (1-As) (1-As) (1-As) Multiply all colors by 1 minus source alpha value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DST_ALPHA
member.summary: Factor: Ad Ad Ad Ad Multiply all colors by source alpha value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA
member.summary: Factor: (1-Ad) (1-Ad) (1-Ad) (1-Ad) Multiply all colors by 1 minus destination alpha value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE
member.summary: Factor: min(As, Ad) min(As,Ad) min(As,Ad) 1 Multiply by the smaller of either source or destination alpha value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.NEVER
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will never pass. i.e. nothing will be drawn.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ALWAYS
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will pass if the new depth value is less than the stored value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LESS
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will pass if the new depth value is less than the stored value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.EQUAL
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will pass if the new depth value is equals to the stored value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LEQUAL
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will pass if the new depth value is less than or equal to the stored value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GREATER
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will pass if the new depth value is greater than the stored value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GEQUAL
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will pass if the new depth value is greater than or equal to the stored value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.NOTEQUAL
member.summary: Passed to depthFunction() or stencilFunction() to specify depth or stencil tests will pass if the new depth value is not equal to the stored value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_EQUATION
member.summary: Passed to blendFuncSeparate to specify an addition blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_EQUATION_RGB
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current rgb blend function. Same as BLEND_EQUATION

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_EQUATION_ALPHA
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current alpha blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FUNC_SUBTRACT
member.summary: Passed to bendFuncSeparate to specify a subtraction blend function (source - destination).

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT
member.summary: Passed to bendFuncSeparate to specify a reverse subtraction blend function (destination - source).

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_DST_RGB
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current destination rgb blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_SRC_RGB
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current destination rgb blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_DST_ALPHA
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current destination alpha blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_SRC_ALPHA
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current source alpha blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CONSTANT_COLOR
member.summary: Passed to blendFunc to specify a constant color blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR
member.summary: Passed to blendFunc to specify one minus a constant color blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CONSTANT_ALPHA
member.summary: Passed to blendFunc to specify a constant alpha blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA
member.summary: Passed to blendFunc to specify one minus a constant alpha blend function.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND_COLOR
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to return a the current blend color.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ARRAY_BUFFER
member.summary: Passed to bindBuffer or bufferData to specify the type of buffer being used.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER
member.summary: Passed to bindBuffer or bufferData to specify the type of buffer being used.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING
member.summary: Passed to getVertexAttrib to recall a buffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current element array buffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STREAM_DRAW
member.summary: Passed to bufferData as a hint about whether the contents of the buffer are likely to not be used often.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STATIC_DRAW
member.summary: Passed to bufferData as a hint about whether the contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and not change often.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DYNAMIC_DRAW
member.summary: Passed to bufferData as a hint about whether the contents of the buffer are likely to be used often and change often.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BUFFER_SIZE
member.summary: Passed to getBufferParameter to get a buffer's size.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BUFFER_USAGE
member.summary: Passed to getBufferParameter to get the hint for the buffer passed in when it was created.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CURRENT_VERTEX_ATTRIB
member.summary: Passed to getVertexAttrib to read back the current vertex attribute.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRONT
member.summary: Passed to cullFace to specify that only front faces should be drawn.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BACK
member.summary: Passed to cullFace to specify that only back faces should be drawn.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRONT_AND_BACK
member.summary: Passed to cullFace to specify that front and back faces should be drawn.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CULL_FACE
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off culling. Can also be used with getParameter to find the current culling method.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLEND
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off blending. Can also be used with getParameter() to find the current blending method.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DITHER
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off dithering. Can also be used with getParameter to find the current dithering method.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_TEST
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off the stencil test. Can also be used with getParameter to query the stencil test.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_TEST
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off the depth test. Can also be used with getParameter to query the depth test.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SCISSOR_TEST
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off the scissor test. Can also be used with getParameter to query the scissor test.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.POLYGON_OFFSET_FILL
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off the polygon offset. Useful for rendering hidden-line images, decals, and or solids with highlighted edges.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SAMPLE_ALPHA_TO_COVERAGE
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off the alpha to coverage. Used in multi-sampling alpha channels.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SAMPLE_COVERAGE
member.summary: Passed to enable()/disable() to turn on/off the sample coverage. Used in multi-sampling.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.NO_ERROR
member.summary: No error has been recorded. This can occur if getError has been called previously, and continues until the error has been corrected.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INVALID_ENUM
member.summary: An unacceptable value for an enumerated argument was specified.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INVALID_VALUE
member.summary: A number that was passed is out of range. The unacceptable value is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INVALID_OPERATION
member.summary: The specified operation isn't allowed for the current state. The command is ignored.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.OUT_OF_MEMORY
member.summary: The command requires more memory than is available. After this error is reported, the state of the WebGL context is undefined except for error flags.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CW
member.summary: Passed to frontFace to specify the front face of a polygon is drawn inthe clockwise direction

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CCW
member.summary: Passed to frontFace to specify the front face of a polygon is drawn inthe counter clockwise direction

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINE_WIDTH
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current lineWidth (set by the lineWidth method).

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ALIASED_POINT_SIZE_RANGE
member.summary: Passed to getParamter to get the current size of a point drawn with gl.POINTS.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ALIASED_LINE_WIDTH_RANGE
member.summary: Passed to getParamter to get the range of available widths for a line. Returns a length-2 array with the lo value at 0, and hight at 1.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CULL_FACE_MODE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current value of cullFace. Should return FRONT, BACK, or FRONT_AND_BACK

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRONT_FACE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to determine the current value of frontFace. Should return CW or CCW.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_RANGE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to return a length-2 array of floats giving the current depth range.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_WRITEMASK
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to determine if the depth write mask is enabled.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_CLEAR_VALUE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to determine the current depth clear value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_FUNC
member.summary: Passed to getParamter to get the current depth function. Returns NEVER, ALWAYS, LESS, EQUAL, LEQUAL, GREATER, GEQUAL, or NOTEQUAL.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_CLEAR_VALUE
member.summary: Passed to getParamter to get the value the stencil will be cleared to.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_FUNC
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current stencil function. Returns NEVER, ALWAYS, LESS, EQUAL, LEQUAL, GREATER, GEQUAL, or NOTEQUAL.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_FAIL
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current stencil fail function. Should return KEEP, REPLACE, INCR, DECR, INVERT, INCR_WRAP, or DECR_WRAP.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_PASS_DEPTH_FAIL
member.summary: Passed to getParamter to get the current stencil fail function should the depth buffer test fail. Should return KEEP, REPLACE, INCR, DECR, INVERT, INCR_WRAP, or DECR_WRAP.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_PASS_DEPTH_PASS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the current stencil fail function should the depth buffer test pass. Should return KEEP, REPLACE, INCR, DECR, INVERT, INCR_WRAP, or DECR_WRAP.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_REF
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the reference value used for stencil tests.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_VALUE_MASK
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the mask that is used to mask both the stencil reference value and the stencil buffer value before they are compared for front-facing polygons and non-polygons. The initial value is all 1's. See glStencilFunc and glStencilFuncSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_WRITEMASK
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the mask that controls writing of the stencil bitplanes for front-facing polygons and non-polygons. The initial value is all 1's. See glStencilMask and glStencilMaskSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BACK_FUNC
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BACK_FAIL
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a symbolic constant indicating what function is used for back-facing polygons to compare the stencil reference value with the stencil buffer value. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS. See glStencilFuncSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BACK_PASS_DEPTH_FAIL
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a symbolic constant indicating what action is taken for back-facing polygons when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. The initial value is GL_KEEP. See glStencilOpSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BACK_PASS_DEPTH_PASS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a symbolic constant indicating what action is taken for back-facing polygons when the stencil test passes and the depth test passes. The initial value is GL_KEEP. See glStencilOpSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BACK_REF
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the reference value that is compared with the contents of the stencil buffer for back-facing polygons. The initial value is 0. See glStencilFuncSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BACK_VALUE_MASK
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the mask that is used for back-facing polygons to mask both the stencil reference value and the stencil buffer value before they are compared. The initial value is all 1's. See glStencilFuncSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BACK_WRITEMASK
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the mask that controls writing of the stencil bitplanes for back-facing polygons. The initial value is all 1's. See glStencilMaskSeparate.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VIEWPORT
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the viewport, i.e. the x and y window coordinates of the viewport, followed by its width and height. Initially the x and y window coordinates are both set to 0, and the width and height are set to the width and height of the window into which the GL will do its rendering. See glViewport.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SCISSOR_BOX
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the scissor box, i.e. the x and y window coordinates of the scissor box, followed by its width and height. Initially the x and y window coordinates are both 0, and the width and height are set to the size of the window. See glScissor.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.COLOR_CLEAR_VALUE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the red, green, blue, and alpha values used to clear the color buffers. Integer values, if requested, are linearly mapped from the internal floating-point representation such that 1.0 returns the most positive representable integer value, and -1.0 returns the most negative representable integer value. The initial value is (0, 0, 0, 0). See glClearColor.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.COLOR_WRITEMASK
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the red, green, blue, and alpha write enables for the color buffers. The initial value is (GL_TRUE, GL_TRUE, GL_TRUE, GL_TRUE). See glColorMask.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNPACK_ALIGNMENT
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the byte alignment used for reading pixel data from memory. The initial value is 4. See glPixelStorei.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.PACK_ALIGNMENT
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the byte alignment used for writing pixel data to memory. The initial value is 4. See glPixelStorei.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get The value gives a rough estimate of the largest texture that the GL can handle. The value must be at least 64. See glTexImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_VIEWPORT_DIMS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum supported width and height of the viewport. These must be at least as large as the visible dimensions of the display being rendered to. See glViewport.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SUBPIXEL_BITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get an estimate of the number of bits of subpixel resolution that are used to position rasterized geometry in window coordinates. The value must be at least 4.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RED_BITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the number of red bitplanes in the color buffer of the currently bound framebuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GREEN_BITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the number of green bitplanes in the color buffer of the currently bound framebuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BLUE_BITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the number of blue bitplanes in the color buffer of the currently bound framebuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ALPHA_BITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the number of alpha bitplanes in the color buffer of the currently bound framebuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_BITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the number of bitplanes in the depth buffer of the currently bound framebuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_BITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer of the currently bound framebuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.POLYGON_OFFSET_UNITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the value that is multiplied by an implementation-specific value and then added to the depth value of each fragment generated when a polygon is rasterized. The initial value is 0. See glPolygonOffset.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.POLYGON_OFFSET_FACTOR
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the scaling factor used to determine the variable offset that is added to the depth value of each fragment generated when a polygon is rasterized. The initial value is 0. See glPolygonOffset.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_BINDING_2D
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the name of the texture currently bound to the target GL_TEXTURE_2D for the active multitexture unit. The initial value is 0. See glBindTexture.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SAMPLE_BUFFERS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SAMPLES
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a single integer value indicating the number of sample buffers associated with the currently bound framebuffer. See glSampleCoverage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SAMPLE_COVERAGE_VALUE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a single positive floating-point value indicating the current sample coverage value. See glSampleCoverage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SAMPLE_COVERAGE_INVERT
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a single boolean value indicating if the temporary coverage value should be inverted. See glSampleCoverage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.COMPRESSED_TEXTURE_FORMATS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a list of symbolic constants of length GL_NUM_COMPRESSED_TEXTURE_FORMATS indicating which compressed texture formats are available. See glCompressedTexImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DONT_CARE
member.summary: No preference. See glHint.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FASTEST
member.summary: The most efficient option should be chosen. See glHint.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.NICEST
member.summary: The most correct, or highest quality, option should be chosen. See glHint.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GENERATE_MIPMAP_HINT
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a symbolic constant indicating the mode of the mipmap generation filtering hint. The initial value is GL_DONT_CARE. See glHint.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BYTE
member.summary: The byte data type

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNSIGNED_BYTE
member.summary: The unsigned byte data type

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SHORT
member.summary: The short data type

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNSIGNED_SHORT
member.summary: The unsigned short data type

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INT
member.summary: The int data type

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNSIGNED_INT
member.summary: The unsigned int data type

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FLOAT
member.summary: The float data type

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_COMPONENT
member.summary: To be used for depth textures. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ALPHA
member.summary: Each element is a single alpha component. The system converts it to floating point, clamped to the range [0, 1], and assembles it into an RGBA element by placing attaching 0.0 to the red, green and blue channels. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RGB
member.summary: Red, green, and blue channels. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RGBA
member.summary: Red, green, blue, and alpha (transparency) channels. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LUMINANCE
member.summary: Each element is a single luminance component. The system converts it to floating point value, clamped to the range [0, 1], and assembles it into an RGBA element by placing the luminance value in the red, green and blue channels, and attaching 1.0 to the alpha channel. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LUMINANCE_ALPHA
member.summary: Each element is an luminance/alpha double. The systems converts each component to floating point, clamped to the range [0, 1], and assembles them into an RGBA element by placing the luminance value in the red, green and blue channels. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4
member.summary: Represents colors in a Uint16Array where red = 4 bits, green=4 bits, blue=4 bits, and alpha=4 bits. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1
member.summary: Represents colors in a Uint16Array where red = 5 bits, green=5 bits, blue=5 bits and alpha=1 bit. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5
member.summary: Represents colors in a Uint16Array where red = 5 bits, green=6 bits, and blue=5 bits. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRAGMENT_SHADER
member.summary: Passed to createShader to define a fragment shader.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_SHADER
member.summary: Passed to createShader to define a vertex shader

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIBS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum number of 4-component generic vertex attributes accessible to a vertex shader. The value must be at least 8. See glVertexAttrib.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_VERTEX_UNIFORM_VECTORS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum number of four-element floating-point, integer, or boolean vectors that can be held in uniform variable storage for a vertex shader. The value must be at least 128. See glUniform.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_VARYING_VECTORS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum number four-element floating-point vectors available for interpolating varying variables used by vertex and fragment shaders. Varying variables declared as matrices or arrays will consume multiple interpolators. The value must be at least 8.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_COMBINED_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum supported texture image units that can be used to access texture maps from the vertex shader and the fragment processor combined. If both the vertex shader and the fragment processing stage access the same texture image unit, then that counts as using two texture image units against this limit. The value must be at least 8. See glActiveTexture.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_VERTEX_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum supported texture image units that can be used to access texture maps from the vertex shader. The value may be 0. See glActiveTexture.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum supported texture image units that can be used to access texture maps from the fragment shader. The value must be at least 8. See glActiveTexture.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_FRAGMENT_UNIFORM_VECTORS
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the maximum number of four-element floating-point, integer, or boolean vectors that can be held in uniform variable storage for a fragment shader. The value must be at least 16. See glUniform.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SHADER_TYPE
member.summary: Passed to getShaderParameter as pname.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DELETE_STATUS
member.summary: Passed to getShaderParameter to determine if a shader was deleted via deleteShader. Returns true if it was, false otherwise.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINK_STATUS
member.summary: Passed to getProgramParameter after calling linkProgram to determine if a program was linked correctly. Returns false if there were errors. Use getProgramInfoLog to find the exact error.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VALIDATE_STATUS
member.summary: Passed to getProgramParameter after calling validateProgram to determine if it is valid. Returns false if errors were found.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ATTACHED_SHADERS
member.summary: Passed to getProgramParameter after calling attachShader to determine if the shader was attached correctly. Returns false if errors occurred.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ACTIVE_UNIFORMS
member.summary: Passed to getProgramParameter to get the number of uniforms active in a program.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ACTIVE_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Passed to getProgramParameter to get the number of attributes active in a program.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CURRENT_PROGRAM
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the name of the program object that is currently active, or 0 if no program object is active. See glUseProgram.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.KEEP
member.summary: Passed to stencilOp. Keeps the current value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.REPLACE
member.summary: Passed to stencilOp. Sets the stencil buffer value to ref, as specified by glStencilFunc.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INCR
member.summary: Passed to stencilOp. Increments the current stencil buffer value. Clamps to the maximum representable unsigned value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DECR
member.summary: Passed to stencilOp. Decrements the current stencil buffer value. Clamps to 0.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INVERT
member.summary: Passed to stencilOp. Bitwise inverts the current stencil buffer value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INCR_WRAP
member.summary: Passed to stencilOp. Increments the current stencil buffer value. Wraps stencil buffer value to zero when incrementing the maximum representable unsigned value.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DECR_WRAP
member.summary: Passed to stencilOp. Decrements the current stencil buffer value. Wraps stencil buffer value to the maximum representable unsigned value when decrementing a stencil buffer value of zero.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VENDOR
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the company responsible for this WebGL implementation. This name does not change from release to release.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RENDERER
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the name of the renderer. This name is typically specific to a particular configuration of a hardware platform. It does not change from release to release.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERSION
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a version or release number of the form WebGL<space>1.0<space><vendor-specific information>.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.SHADING_LANGUAGE_VERSION
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get a version or release number of the form WebGL $lt;space$gt;GLSL$lt;space$gt;ES$lt;space$gt;1.0$lt;space$gt;$lt;vendor-specific information$gt;.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.NEAREST
member.summary: Returns the value of the texture element that is nearest (in Manhattan distance) to the center of the pixel being textured. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINEAR
member.summary: Returns the weighted average of the four texture elements that are closest to the center of the pixel being textured. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST
member.summary: Chooses the mipmap that most closely matches the size of the pixel being textured and uses the GL_NEAREST criterion (the texture element nearest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST
member.summary: Chooses the mipmap that most closely matches the size of the pixel being textured and uses the GL_LINEAR criterion (a weighted average of the four texture elements that are closest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR
member.summary: Chooses the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of the pixel being textured and uses the GL_NEAREST criterion (the texture element nearest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value from each mipmap. The final texture value is a weighted average of those two values. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR
member.summary: Chooses the two mipmaps that most closely match the size of the pixel being textured and uses the GL_LINEAR criterion (a weighted average of the four texture elements that are closest to the center of the pixel) to produce a texture value from each mipmap. The final texture value is a weighted average of those two values. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER
member.summary: The texture magnification function is used when the pixel being textured maps to an area less than or equal to one texture element. It sets the texture magnification function to either GL_NEAREST or GL_LINEAR (see below). GL_NEAREST is generally faster than GL_LINEAR, but it can produce textured images with sharper edges because the transition between texture elements is not as smooth. The initial value of GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER is GL_LINEAR. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER
member.summary: The texture minifying function is used whenever the pixel being textured maps to an area greater than one texture element. There are six defined minifying functions. Two of them use the nearest one or nearest four texture elements to compute the texture value. The other four use mipmaps. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_WRAP_S
member.summary: Sets the wrap parameter for texture coordinate s. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_WRAP_T
member.summary: Sets the wrap parameter for texture coordinate t. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_2D
member.summary: Represents a 2D image. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE
member.summary: Represents a texture. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP
member.summary: The texture is composed of six 2D images, one for each face of a cube. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_BINDING_CUBE_MAP
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the name of the texture currently bound to the target GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP for the active multitexture unit. The initial value is 0. See glBindTexture.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X

member.summary: Image for the positive Y face of the cube map. See texImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_CUBE_MAP_TEXTURE_SIZE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the value gives a rough estimate of the largest cube-map texture that the GL can handle. The value must be at least 16. See glTexImage2D.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ACTIVE_TEXTURE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the active multitexture unit. The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0. See glActiveTexture.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.REPEAT
member.summary: The wrap parameter for texture coordinate. REPEAT causes the integer part of the coordinate to be ignored. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CLAMP_TO_EDGE
member.summary: The wrap parameter for texture coordinates. CLAMP_TO_EDGE causes coordinates to be clamped. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MIRRORED_REPEAT
member.summary: The wrap parameter for texture coordinate. MIRRORED_REPEAT causes the s coordinate to be set to the fractional part of the texture coordinate. See glTexParameter.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_ENABLED
member.summary: Passed to the getVertexAttrib to get a single value that is non-zero (true) if the vertex attribute array for index is enabled and 0 (false) if it is disabled. The initial value is GL_FALSE.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_SIZE
member.summary: Passed to the getVertexAttrib to get a single value, the size of the vertex attribute array for index. The size is the number of values for each element of the vertex attribute array, and it will be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_STRIDE
member.summary: Passed to the getVertexAttrib to get a single value, the array stride for (number of bytes between successive elements in) the vertex attribute array for index. A value of 0 indicates that the array elements are stored sequentially in memory. The initial value is 0.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_TYPE
member.summary: Passed to the getVertexAttrib to get a single value, a symbolic constant indicating the array type for the vertex attribute array for index. Possible values are GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_FIXED and GL_FLOAT. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_NORMALIZED
member.summary: Passed to the getVertexAttrib to get a single value that is non-zero (true) if fixed-point data types for the vertex attribute array indicated by index are normalized when they are converted to floating point, and 0 (false) otherwise. The initial value is GL_FALSE.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_POINTER
member.summary: Passed to the vertexAttribPointer to get the address of the specified generic vertex attribute pointer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING
member.summary: Passed to the getVertexAttrib to get the the name of the buffer object currently bound to he binding point corresponding to generic vertex attribute array index. If no buffer object is bound, 0 is returned. The initial value is 0.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.IMPLEMENTATION_COLOR_READ_TYPE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the type chosen by the implementation with which pixels may be read from the color buffer of the currently bound framebuffer in conjunction with GL_IMPLEMENTATION_COLOR_READ_FORMAT. In addition to this implementation-dependent format/type pair, format GL_RGBA in conjunction with type GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE is always allowed by every implementation, regardless of the currently bound render surface. See glReadPixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.IMPLEMENTATION_COLOR_READ_FORMAT
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the format chosen by the implementation in which pixels may be read from the color buffer of the currently bound framebuffer in conjunction with GL_IMPLEMENTATION_COLOR_READ_TYPE. In addition to this implementation-dependent format/type pair, format GL_RGBA in conjunction with type GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE is always allowed by every implementation, regardless of the currently bound render surface. See glReadPixels.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.COMPILE_STATUS
member.summary: Passed to getShaderParameter to get the status of the compilation. Returns false if the shader was not compiled. You can then query getShaderInfoLog to find the exact error.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.LOW_FLOAT
member.summary: The shader precision type. See getShaderPrecisionFormat.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MEDIUM_FLOAT

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MEDIUM_INT
member.summary: The shader precision type. See getShaderPrecisionFormat.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.HIGH_INT
member.summary: The shader precision type. See getShaderPrecisionFormat.

member.summary: Passed to bindFramebuffer as a target.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RENDERBUFFER
member.summary: Passed to bindRenderbuffer as a target.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RGBA4
member.summary: RGBA with 4 bits per channel. See renderbufferStorage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RGB5_A1
member.summary: RGBA value with 5 bits for RGB and 1 bit for Alpha. See renderbufferStorage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RGB565
member.summary: RGB value with 5 bits red, 6 bits green, and 5 bits blue respectively. See renderbufferStorage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_COMPONENT16
member.summary: 16 bit Depth component. See renderbufferStorage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_INDEX
member.summary: The stencil-renderable format of the renderbuffer. See renderbufferStorage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.STENCIL_INDEX8
member.summary: The stencil-renderable format of the renderbuffer. See renderbufferStorage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DEPTH_STENCIL
member.summary: Call renderbufferStorage with the DEPTH_STENCIL internal format to attach both depth and stencil buffers to a framebuffer object.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE
member.summary: Passed to getFramebufferAttachmentParameter to get the type of object which contains the attached image, either GL_RENDERBUFFER, GL_TEXTURE, or if no image is attached, GL_NONE. The initial value is GL_NONE.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_NAME
member.summary: Passed to getFramebufferAttachmentParameter as a parameter name. If the value of GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE is GL_RENDERBUFFER, params returns the name of the renderbuffer object which contains the attached image. If the value of GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE is GL_TEXTURE, params returns the name of the texture object which contains the attached image. The initial value is zero.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_TEXTURE_LEVEL
member.summary: Passed to getFramebufferAttachmentParameter as a parameter name. If the value of GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE is GL_TEXTURE, params returns the mipmap level of the texture object which contains the attached image. The initial value is zero.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_FACE
member.summary: Passed to getFramebufferAttachmentParameter as a parameter name. If the value of GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_TYPE is GL_TEXTURE and GL_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_OBJECT_NAME is the name of a cube-map texture, params returns the cube map face of the cube-map texture object which contains the attached image. If the attached image is from a texture object but not a cube-map, params returns 0. The initial value is GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FRAMEBUFFER_BINDING
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the name of the currently bound framebuffer. The initial value is 0, indicating the default framebuffer. See glBindFramebuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.RENDERBUFFER_BINDING
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the name of the currently bound renderbuffer. The initial value is 0, indicating no renderbuffer is bound. See glBindRenderbuffer.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.MAX_RENDERBUFFER_SIZE
member.summary: Passed to getParameter to get the value indicates the largest renderbuffer width and height that the GL can handle. The value must be at least 1. See glRenderbufferStorage.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.INVALID_FRAMEBUFFER_OPERATION
member.summary: The command is trying to render to or read from the framebuffer while the currently bound framebuffer is not framebuffer complete (i.e. the return value from glCheckFramebufferStatus is not GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE). The offending command is ignored and has no other side effect than to set the error flag.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNPACK_FLIP_Y_WEBGL
member.summary: Flips the source data along its vertical axis when texImage2D or texSubImage2D are called when param is true. The initial value for param is false. See pixelStorei.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNPACK_PREMULTIPLY_ALPHA_WEBGL
member.summary: Multiplies the alpha channel, if it exists, into the other color channels during the data transfer when texImage2D or texSubImage2D are called when param is true. The initial value for param is false. See pixelStorei.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CONTEXT_LOST_WEBGL
member.summary: If WebGL context is lost, this error is returned on the first call to getError. Subsequent calls return NO_ERROR until context is restored.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.UNPACK_COLORSPACE_CONVERSION_WEBGL
member.summary: The browser's default colorspace conversion is applied when texImage2D or texSubImage2D are called with an HTMLImageElement texture data source. The initial value for param is BROWSER_DEFAULT_WEBGL. No colorspace conversion is applied when set to NONE. See pixelStorei.

member.name: F:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BROWSER_DEFAULT_WEBGL
member.summary: If set to BROWSER_DEFAULT_WEBGL, then the browser's default colorspace conversion is applied during subsequent texImage2D and texSubImage2D calls taking HTMLImageElement. The precise conversions may be specific to both the browser and file type. If set to NONE, no colorspace conversion is applied. The initial value is BROWSER_DEFAULT_WEBGL. See pixelStorei.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BindAttribLocation(Bridge.WebGL.WebGLProgram,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Binds a generic vertex index to a user-defined attribute variable. More than one name can be bound to the same vertex index, but multiple indexes cannot be bound to the same name. If name is a matrix attribute, then index points to the first column of the matrix. Additional matrix columns are automatically bound to index+1, index+2, and so forth based on matrix variable (mat2,mat3,mat4).
Errors: gl.INVALID_VALUE If index is greater than or equal to gl.MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIBS. gl.INVALID_VALUE If program is not generated by WebGL. gl.INVALID_OPERATION If name starts with the reserved prefix gl_. gl.INVALID_OPERATION If program isn't a program object.
member.param: Program object to bind.
The index of the generic vertex to bind.
me of the user variable to a bind to the generic vertex index.

member.summary:
Sets the equation used to blend RGB and Alpha values of an incoming source fragment with a destination values as stored in the fragment's frame buffer.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BlendEquationSeparate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Controls the blending of an incoming source fragment's R, G, B, and A values with a destination R, G, B, and A values as stored in the fragment's WebGLFramebuffer. Blending is dependent on the incoming fragment's alpha value of the currently stored pixel.
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM - If modeRGB or modeAlpha are not one of the three possible values.
member.param: One of these values: gl.FUNC_ADD, gl.FUNC_SUBTRACT, gl.FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT
One of these values: gl.FUNC_ADD, gl.FUNC_SUBTRACT, gl.FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BlendFunc(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the blending factors used to combine source and destination pixels. The blending function is calculated like this: color(RGBA) = ((source color) * sfactor) + ((destination color) * dfactor). Values of colors are between 0 and 1 for each RGB value. Alpha values are between 1 (fully opaque) and 0 (fully transparent). Possible sfactor and dfactors multipliers are: ZERO, ONE, SRC_COLOR, ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, DST_COLOR, ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, SRC_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, DST_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM - If the sfactor or the dfactor isn't one of the listed values.
member.param: A multiplier for the source color.
A multiplier for destination color.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BlendFuncSeparate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the weighting factors that are used by blendEquationSeparate.
Possible values for multipliers: ZERO, ONE, SRC_COLOR, ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, DST_COLOR, ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, SRC_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, DST_ALPHA, ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM - If the srcRGB or the srcAlpha isn't one of the listed values.
member.param: A multiplier for the source color.
A multiplier for the destination color.
A multiplier for the source alpha.
A multiplier for the destination alpha.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.BufferData(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a buffer in memory and initializes it with array data. If no array is provided, the contents of the buffer is initialized to 0. BufferData deletes any existing data store and sets the state variables gl.BUFFER_SIZE and gl.BUFFER_USAGE to the new values.
Errors: gl.OUT_OF_MEMORY - If WebGL can't create the buffer to the requested size.
member.param: Set to gl.ARRAY_BUFFER or gl.ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER.
The size of the buffer to initialize

One of the following values: gl.STATIC_DRAW The data store contents are modified once, and used many times as the source for WebGL drawing commands. gl.DYNAMIC_DRAW The data store contents are repeatedly respecified, and used many times as the source for WebGL drawing commands. gl.STREAM_DRAW The data store contents are specified once, and used occasionally as the source of a WebGL drawing command.
Usage is provided only as a performance hint. The usage value doesn't restrict the way the data store is used.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CheckFramebufferStatus(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns whether the currently bound WebGLFramebuffer is complete. If not complete, returns the reason why.
One of the following: gl.FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE The frame buffer is ready to display. gl.FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_ATTACHMENT The attachment types are mismatched. gl.FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_MISSING_ATTACHMENT There is no attachment. gl.FRAMEBUFFER_INCOMPLETE_DIMENSIONS The height and width of the attachments are not the same. gl.FRAMEBUFFER_UNSUPPORTED The attachments aren't supported.
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM - If the target isn't gl.FRAMEBUFFER.
member.param: The following constant - gl.FRAMEBUFFER
member.returns: The current status of WebGLFramebuffer

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.Clear(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets all pixels in a specific buffer to the same value.
The mask parameter contains one or both (OR'd together) of the following values: gl.DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT Clears the depth buffer gl.STENCIL_BUFFER_BIT Clears the stencil buffer gl.COLOR_BUFFER_BIT Clears the color buffer
The clear method sets the buffer to values preselected by clearColor, clearDepth, or clearStencil. If a buffer doesn't exist, this method has no effect. The clear function can be used to clear the stencil buffer either by itself or in conjunction with other buffers (such as the color or depth buffers). You can set a stencil write mask prior to clearing the stencil buffer, and the stencil write mask will be respected during the clear operation. This also applies to when the stencil test is disabled.
Examples: gl.clear(gl.DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT); gl.clear(gl.COLOR_BUFFER_BIT | gl.DEPTH_BUFFER_BIT);
Errors: gl.INVALID_VALUE If any bit other than the ones listed are defined in mask. gl.INVALID_FRAMEBUFFER_OPERATION framebuffer or renderbuffer is in valid.
member.param: Contains one or both (OR'd together) of the buffer bits.

member.summary: Specifies color values to use by the clear method to clear the color buffer. The parameters must be in the range of 0 - 1. The default value is 0.
member.param: The red component.
The green component.
The blue component.
The alpha component.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ClearDepth(System.Double)
member.summary: Clears the depth buffer to a specific value.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.ClearStencil(System.Double)
member.summary: Specifies the clear value to be used by the clear method to clear the stencil buffer. The s parameter is masked with 2m - 1, where m is the number of bits in the stencil buffer.
member.param: A value in the range of 0 to 1 to clear the stencil buffer to. Default value is 0.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CompileShader(Bridge.WebGL.WebGLShader)
member.summary:
Compiles the GLSL shader source into binary data used by the WebGLProgram object.
When compiling shader source code, call getShaderParameter to get the status. getShaderParameter returns true if the source compiled successfully, or false if compilation failed. On failure, call getShaderInfoLog for the shader compiler's log. Errors are contained in the log.
Errors: gl.INVALID_VALUE The shader isn't a WebGLShader object. The shader is not generated by WebGL.
gl.INVALID_OPERATION The shader compiler isn't supported.
member.param: An object that represents source code strings.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CompressedTexImage2D(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Bridge.Html5.ArrayBufferView)
member.summary:
Specifies a two-dimensional texture image or cube Map image from compressed image data. You must call getExtension("WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc") to enable compressed textures before calling this method.
Errors: gl.INVALID_VALUE If internalFormat does not equal one of the specified values. gl.INVALID_OPERATION If width or height are not a multiple of 4. gl.INVALID_ENUM If target isn't one of the specified values. gl.INVALID_ENUM If internalFormat isn't a supported format. gl.INVALID_VALUE If width or width is less than 0 or greater than gl.MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE. gl.INVALID_VALUE If border is not 0.
member.param: The target texture. One of the following: gl.TEXTURE_2D Uses a 2D image. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X Image for the positive X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X Image for the negative X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y Image for the positive Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y Image for the negative Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z Image for the positive Z face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z Image for the negative Z face of the cube map.
The level of detail. Level 0 equals the base image level.

The image format of the compressed image stored in memory. Use one of the following: COMPRESSED_RGB_S3TC_DXT1_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 8 COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT1_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 8 COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT3_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 16 COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT5_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 16
The width of the texture image. A 2D texture image needs to be at least 64 texels wide, and cube-mapped texture images should be 16 texels wide.
The height of the texture image. A 2D texture image needs to be at least 64 texels high, and cube-mapped texture images should be 16 texels high.
Width of border.
Object that contains the image data.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CompressedTexSubImage2D(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Specifies a two-dimensional texture or cube Map sub-image from compressed image data. You must call getExtension("WEBGL_compressed_texture_s3tc") to enable compressed textures before calling this method.
member.param: The target texture. One of the following: gl.TEXTURE_2D Uses a 2D image. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X Image for the positive X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X Image for the negative X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y Image for the positive Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y Image for the negative Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z Image for the positive Z face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z Image for the negative Z face of the cube map.
The level of detail. Level 0 equals the base image level.
The horizontal offset of the image in the texture array.
The vertical offset of the image in the texture array.
The width of the subimage texture.
The height of the subimage texture.

The format or extension of the compressed image. This must be the same format specified previously by compressedTexImage2D. Possible values: COMPRESSED_RGB_S3TC_DXT1_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 8 COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT1_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 8 COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT3_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 16 COMPRESSED_RGBA_S3TC_DXT5_EXT The byteLength of data (ArrayBufferView) in pixels that's passed must be match the equation floor((width + 3) / 4) * floor((height + 3) / 4) * 16

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CopyTexImage2D(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Copies a rectangle of pixels from the current WebGLFramebuffer into a texture image. CopyTexImage2D doesn't support floating point texture sources or destinations.
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM Value of target is not one of the specified constants.
gl.INVALID_VALUE The value of level is < 0. If xoffset is < 0. If yoffset is < 0. If xoffset + width is greater than the width of the image being modified. If yoffset + height is greater than the height of the image being modified. If width or if height is < 0.
gl.INVALID_OPERATION No WebGLTexture is bound.
gl.INVALID_FRAMEBUFFER_OPERATION The currently bound WebGLFramebuffer is not framebuffer complete checkFramebufferStatus does not return gl.FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE The currently bound WebGLRenderbuffer is invalid.
member.param: The target texture. One of the following: gl.TEXTURE_2D Uses a 2D image. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X Image for the positive X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X Image for the negative X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y Image for the positive Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y Image for the negative Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z Image for the positive Z face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z Image for the negative Z face of the cube map.
The level of detail. Level 0 equals the base image level. Additional levels (n) equal the nth mipmap reduction image. See generateMipmap to create mipmaps.

Specifies the internal format of the texture. gl.ALPHA Each element is a single alpha component. The system converts it to floating point, clamped to the range [0, 1], and assembles it into an RGBA element by placing attaching 0.0 to the red, green and blue channels. gl.LUMINANCE Each element is a single luminance component. The system converts it to floating point value, clamped to the range [0, 1], and assembles it into an RGBA element by placing the luminance value in the red, green and blue channels, and attaching 1.0 to the alpha channel. gl.LUMINANCE_ALPHA Each element is an luminance/alpha double. The systems converts each component to floating point, clamped to the range [0, 1], and assembles them into an RGBA element by placing the luminance value in the red, green and blue channels. gl.RGB Red, green, and blue channels. gl.RGBA Red, green, blue, and alpha (transparency) channels.
Horizontal coordinate of the lower left corner of the pixels to copy.
Vertical coordinate of the lower left corner of the pixels to copy.
The width of the rectangle or box you want to copy from. A 2D texture image needs to be at least 64 texels wide, and cube-mapped texture images should be 16 texels wide.
The height of the rectangle or box you want to copy from. A 2D texture image needs to be at least 64 texels high, and cube-mapped texture images should be 16 texels high.
Width of border.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.CopyTexSubImage2D(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Replaces a portion of an existing 2D texture image with data from the current framebuffer. CopyTexImage2D doesn't support floating point texture sources or destinations.
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM Value of target is not one of the specified constants.
gl.INVALID_VALUE The value of level is < 0. If xoffset is < 0. If yoffset is < 0. If xoffset + width is greater than the width of the image being modified. If yoffset + height is greater than the height of the image being modified. If width or if height is < 0.
gl.INVALID_OPERATION No WebGLTexture is bound.
gl.INVALID_FRAMEBUFFER_OPERATION The currently bound WebGLFramebuffer is not framebuffer complete checkFramebufferStatus does not return gl.FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE
member.param: The target texture. One of the following: gl.TEXTURE_2D Uses a 2D image. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X Image for the positive X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X Image for the negative X face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y Image for the positive Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y Image for the negative Y face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z Image for the positive Z face of the cube map. gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z Image for the negative Z face of the cube map.
The level of detail. Level 0 equals the base image level. Additional levels (n) equal the nth mipmap reduction image. See generateMipmap to create mipmaps.
The horizontal offset of the image in the texture array.
The vertical offset of the image in the texture array.
Horizontal coordinate of the lower left corner of the pixels to copy.
Vertical coordinate of the lower left corner of the pixels to copy.
The width of the texture subimage.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.DrawArrays(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Render geometric primitives from bound and enabled vertex data.
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM If mode is not an accepted value. gl.INVALID_VALUE If count is negative. gl.INVALID_FRAMEBUFFER_OPERATION If the currently bound WebGLFramebuffer is not framebuffer complete or the WebGLRenderbuffer is invalid. gl.INVALID_OPERATION The vertex attribute is enabled but no buffer is bound or if first + count goes past the end of the vertex attribute array.
member.param: Specifies the kind of geometric primitives to render from a given set of vertex attributes. gl.POINTS Draws a single dot per vertex. For example, 10 vertices produce 10 dots. gl.LINES Draws a line between a pair of vertices. For example, 10 vertices produce 5 separate lines. gl.LINE_STRIP Draws a line to the next vertex by a straight line. For example, 10 vertices produce 9 lines connected end to end. gl.LINE_LOOP Similar to gl.LINE_STRIP, but connects the last vertex back to the first. For example, 10 vertices produce 10 straight lines. gl.TRIANGLES Draws a triangle for each group of three consecutive vertices. For example, 12 vertices create 4 separate triangles. gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP Creates a strip of triangles where each additional vertex creates an additional triangle once the first three vertices have been drawn. For example, 12 vertices create 10 triangles. gl.TRIANGLE_FAN Similar to gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP, but creates a fan shaped output. For example 12 vertices create 10 triangles.
The first element to render in the array of vector points.
The number of vector points to render. For example, a triangle would be 3.

For example, 12 vertices create 4 separate triangles. gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP Creates a strip of triangles where each additional vertex creates an additional triangle once the first three vertices have been drawn. For example, 12 vertices create 10 triangles. gl.TRIANGLE_FAN Similar to gl.TRIANGLE_STRIP, but creates a fan shaped output. For example 12 vertices create 10 triangles.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.FrontFace(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets whether or not polygons are considered front-facing based on their winding direction. A polygon has a clockwise winding if an imaginary object following a path moves in a clockwise direction from the first vertex, second vertex, and so forth, to the last vertex, and then back to the first vertex. It's counterclockwise winding if it moves in the opposite direction. To turn rendering of back-facing polygons on or off, call enable or disable using CULL_FACE as the argument.
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM Mode is not CW or CCW.
member.param: Sets orientation of front-facing polygons. gl.CCW Initial value. Counterclockwise winding. gl.CW Clockwise winding.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GenerateMipmap(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Creates a set of textures for a WebGLTexture object with image dimensions from the original size of the image down to a 1x1 image. A mipmap is used to simulate distance with objects. A high-resolution mipmap image is used for objects that are close to the user. Lower-resolution images are used as the object appears farther away. Using mipmaps improves the quality of rendered textures at the expense of using more memory. The internal format of a mipmap array is the same as the zero level texture image. Each level is half the resolution of the previous level, until a 1x1 dimension texture image is created.
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM target isn't specified as gl.TEXTURE_2D or gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP. gl.INVALID_OPERATION If the width or height of the zero level (original texture) array is not a power of two.
member.param: The texture target of the active texture unit. gl.TEXTURE_2D gl.TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GetError
member.summary:
Returns a value for the WebGL error flag and clears the flag. No additional errors are recorded until this method is called. When you call getError, it returns the error code and resets the error flag.
Possible errors:
OUT_OF_MEMORY The command requires more memory than is available. After this error is reported, the state of the WebGL context is undefined except for error flags. INVALID_ENUM An unacceptable value for an enumerated argument was specified. INVALID_OPERATION The specified operation isn't allowed for the current state. The command is ignored. INVALID_FRAMEBUFFER_OPERATION The command is attempting to read or render from a framebuffer that is not framebuffer complete. A call to checkFramebufferStatus doesn't return gl.FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE. INVALID_VALUE A number that was passed is out of range. The unacceptable value is ignored. CONTEXT_LOST_WEBGL If WebGL context is lost, this error is returned on the first call to getError. Subsequent calls return NO_ERROR until context is restored. NO_ERROR No error has been recorded. This can occur if getError has been called previously, and continues until the error has been corrected.
member.returns: Error code.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Enables a passed extension, otherwise returns null. Returns null if an extension isn't supported.
member.param: A case-insensitive name of the extension. OES_texture_float When enabled, allows 128bits-per-pixel texture components rather than 32bit to be used with texImage2D and texSubImage2D. Call getExtension("gl.OES_texture_float"). When using floating-point textures, linear filtering isn't supported, only nearest filtering. EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic 0x84FE Call getExtension("gl.EXT_texture_filter_anisotropic") to enable. When enabled provides anisotropic filtering functionality. Anisotropic filtering enhances image quality for textures at oblique viewing angles. For more info, see Anisotropic filtering.
member.returns: Object that contains any existing constants or functions defined in the extension, or null.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.GetVertexAttrib(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns data for a particular characteristic of a vertex attribute at an index in a vertex attribute array.
The following table shows the return value for a given pName. Parameter Returned type Description
gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_BUFFER_BINDING WebGLBuffer The name of the currently bound buffer object. Returns 0 if no buffer is bound. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_ENABLED Boolean Returns true if the vertex attribute at index is enabled, otherwise false. Initial value is false. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_SIZE Number Returns the size (1,2,3,or 4) for an element of the vertex array. Initial value is 4. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_STRIDE Number Returns the number of bytes between successive elements in the array. The value 0 means the elements are sequential in memory. Initial value is 0. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_TYPE GLenum Returns a constant representing the array type. Possible values are: gl.BYTE, gl.UNSIGNED_BYTE, gl.SHORT, gl.UNSIGNED_SHORT, gl.FIXED, gl.FLOAT. The initial value is gl.FLOAT. gl.VERTEX_ATTRIB_ARRAY_NORMALIZED Boolean Returns true if fixed-point data types for the vertex attribute array at index are normalized when converted to floating point. Otherwise false is returned. Initial value is false. gl.CURRENT_VERTEX_ATTRIB Float32Array Returns four values that currently represent the value of the vertex attribute at index. Initial value is 0,0,0,1. (with 4 elements)
Errors: gl.INVALID_ENUM If pname isn't an accepted value. gl.INVALID_VALUE If index is greater than or equal to gl.MAX_VERTEX_ATTRIBS.

member.name: M:Bridge.WebGL.WebGLRenderingContext.PixelStorei(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets pixel storage modes for readPixels and unpacking of textures with texImage2D and texSubImage2D .
member.param: The symbolic parameter name. One of the following: gl.PACK_ALIGNMENT Affects packing of pixel data into memory. The initial param value is 4, but it can be set to 1,2,4, or 8. gl.UNPACK_ALIGNMENT Affects unpacking of pixel data from memory. The initial param value is 4, but can be set to 1,2,4, or 8. gl.UNPACK_FLIP_Y_WEBGL Flips the source data along its vertical axis when texImage2D or texSubImage2D are called when param is true. The initial value for param is false. gl.UNPACK_PREMULTIPLY_ALPHA_WEBGL Multiplies the alpha channel, if it exists, into the other color channels during the data transfer when texImage2D or texSubImage2D are called when param is true. The initial value for param is false. gl.UNPACK_COLORSPACE_CONVERSION_WEBGL The browser's default colorspace conversion is applied when texImage2D or texSubImage2D are called with an HTMLImageElement texture data source. The initial value for param is BROWSER_DEFAULT_WEBGL. No colorspace conversion is applied when set to NONE.
Values depend on value of pname.
